org.jogger
Class Jogger

java.lang.Object
  org.jogger.Jogger

public class Jogger
extends Object

Use this class to configure your application's routes, interceptors, template engine, exception handlers, etc.

Adding routes

There are multiple ways in which you can add routes:
  1. Using the get, post, etc. methods: 
     Jogger app = new Jogger();
 app.get("/", new RouteHandler() {
        @Override
        public void handle(Request request, Response response) {
        
        }
 });
  2. Using the addRoute methods. In this case, the class MyController with a method root (that receives a Request and Response) must exists. 
     Jogger app = new Jogger();
 app.addRoute(HttpMethod.GET, "/", new MyController(), "root");
  3. Setting the routes list directly with the method setRoutes(List). 
     Jogger app = new Jogger();
 List routes = ...; // retreive the routes somehow
 app.setRoutes(routes);
To learn how to load routes from a file or using annotations click here.

Default configuration

When you instantiate this class it comes with the following default configuration:
  • An empty route list (i.e. no routes).
  • An empty interceptor list (i.e. no interceptors).
  • A FileAssetLoader for loading static files.
  • A FreemarkerTemplateEngine for loading and rendering templates.
You can then add routes, interceptors, change the AssetLoader and TemplateEngine implementations, etc.

Author:
German Escobar

Constructor Detail

Jogger

public Jogger()
Constructor. Initializes the object with the default configuration.

Method Detail

getRoute

public Route getRoute(String httpMethod,
                      String path)
Retrieves the Route that matches the specified httpMethod and path.

Parameters:
httpMethod - the HTTP method to match. Should not be null or empty.
path - the path to match. Should not be null but can be empty (which is interpreted as /)
Returns:
a Route object that matches the arguments or null if no route matches.

getRoutes

public List<Route> getRoutes()

setRoutes

public void setRoutes(List<Route> routes)

addRoute

public void addRoute(Route route)
Adds a route to the list of routes using a Route object.

Parameters:
route - the route to be added.

addRoute

public void addRoute(Route.HttpMethod httpMethod,
                     String path,
                     Object controller,
                     String methodName)
              throws NoSuchMethodException
Creates a Route object from the received arguments and adds it to the list of routes.

Parameters:
httpMethod - the HTTP method to which this route is going to respond.
path - the path to which this route is going to respond.
controller - the object that will be invoked when this route matches.
methodName - the name of the method in the controller object that will be invoked when this route matches.
Throws:
NoSuchMethodException - if the methodName is not found or doesn't have the right signature.

addRoute

public void addRoute(Route.HttpMethod httpMethod,
                     String path,
                     Object controller,
                     Method method)
Creates a Route object from the received arguments and adds it to the list of routes.

Parameters:
httpMethod - the HTTP method to which this route is going to respond.
path - the path to which this route is going to respond.
controller - the object that will be invoked when this route matches.
method - the Method that will be invoked when this route matches.

get

public void get(String path,
                RouteHandler handler)
Creates a Route object and adds it to the routes list. It will respond to the GET HTTP method and the specified path invoking the RouteHandler object.

Parameters:
path - the path to which this route will respond.
handler - the object that will be invoked when the route matches.

Parameters:

handler - the object that will be invoked when the route matches.

addInterceptor

public void addInterceptor(Interceptor interceptor,
                           String... paths)
Adds the interceptor to the list of interceptors that will matches the specified paths.

Parameters:
interceptor - the interceptor object to be added.
paths - the paths in which this interceptor will be invoked, an empty array to respond to all paths.
